curiosity-story.text: A Truth That Changes Everything. Here's a truth that will change how you see the world: the quality of your understanding depends entirely on the quality of your questions. Most people never realize this.
The Surface Thinker. Most people accept the first answer they get. They hear something, nod, and move on. Surface thinkers ask 'Why is climate change happening?' hear 'pollution,' and stop there.
The Deep Thinker. Deep thinkers keep asking why. Why pollution? Why so much? What causes that? They go six levels deep and truly understand the whole system, not just the surface.

The Curiosity Advantage. A curious person who asks great questions will always beat a 'smart' person who accepts surface-level answers. Intelligence isn't about knowing things—it's about knowing how to find things out.
Your Choice. Every time you encounter something new, you have a choice: accept the first answer, or keep asking why. The people who change the world consistently choose to go deeper.

six-levels-story.text: The Framework. The framework is beautifully simple: when you want to understand something, ask 'why?' at least six times. Each answer reveals a new layer of truth.

Levels 1-2: Where Most Stop. Ninety percent of people stop at levels one and two. 'Why homework?' 'To practice.' 'Why practice?' 'So things stick.' They feel satisfied, but they've barely scratched the surface.

Levels 3-4: Getting Interesting. At level three, things get interesting. 'Why does practice make things stick?' Your brain strengthens neural pathways when you repeat something. Now you're learning how your brain actually works!

Levels 5-6: Real Understanding. At levels five and six, you reach evolutionary neuroscience. Your brain prioritizes what to remember based on repetition because it was survival-critical for our ancestors. Mind. Blown.

The Transformation. You went from 'why homework?' to understanding human evolution. Now you don't just do homework because you're told to—you understand how your brain actually works. That's the power of going deep!
Level 6: The Real Problem. Level six: Why does it seem too technical and expensive? Because they don't know about AI tools that make it easy and free. Now we've found a problem we can actually solve!
The Key Insight. If you can get just two or three levels deeper than most people, you're already ahead of ninety-nine percent of the world. Most people accept surface-level answers. You won't.

comprehension-story.text: Questions Are the Tool. Questions are the tool. Comprehension is the result. When you truly comprehend something, you can do four powerful things that prove you really understand.
Explain It Simply. If you can't explain something simply, you don't really understand it. After going six levels deep, try explaining the concept to a younger kid. Can you do it without jargon?
Find Connections. True understanding means seeing how things connect to other things you know. Ask: how does this relate to history? To science? To my own life? Connections deepen understanding.
Predict Outcomes. When you deeply understand something, you can predict what will happen. 'If X happens, then Y will probably follow because...' Prediction proves comprehension.
Apply to New Situations. Real comprehension lets you use knowledge in completely new contexts. Understanding isn't memorizing facts—it's having transferable insight that works everywhere.

Become a Master Questioner. Practice these skills and you become a master questioner. You'll see the world differently. Problems become puzzles to solve. Confusion becomes curiosity. The art of questions is your superpower!
